author: Chris Michael
title: How bad is Delhi's air? We strapped a monitor to a rickshaw to find out | Cities | The Guardian
text:
The air we breathe How bad is Delhi's air? We strapped a monitor to a rickshaw to find out 
Suresh Kumar Sharma is an auto-rickshaw driver in Delhi, a city with some of the world’s dirtiest air – and where many locals don’t know how unhealthy it is. We monitored the dangerous PM2.5 particles surrounding Suresh’s rickshaw for 12 hours, then had his lungs tested: ‘I was shocked’ Cities is supported by
